selected_quotes: Phys. Rev. Lett. 118, 124501 (2017) - Coarse-Graining the Fluid Flow around a Human Sperm
Check out our latest publication: Coarse-Graining the Fluid Flow around a Human Sperm
El mejor peiper del mes, SIONO

citation.abstract: The flagellar beat is extracted from human sperm digital imaging microscopy and used to determine the flow around the cell and its trajectory, via boundary element simulation. Comparison of the predicted cell trajectory with observation demonstrates that simulation can predict fine-scale sperm dynamics at the qualitative level. The flow field is also observed to reduce to a time-dependent summation of regularized Stokes flow singularities, approximated at leading order by a blinking force triplet. Such regularized singularity decompositions may be used to upscale cell level detail into population models of human sperm motility.
citation.title: Coarse-Graining the Fluid Flow around a Human Sperm

news.title: Rhythm sperm swim at revealed in breakthrough for treating male infertility
news.summary: Researchers in Japan and Britain have discovered sperm do not swim randomly as previously thought Sperm move to a four-beat rhythm in a discovery which could hail the next step in treating male infertility.

news.title: Sperm mystery: HOW sperm make difficult ‘journey’ - finding could help TREAT infertility

news.title: Why sperm need to go backwards to reach the egg - Futurity
